slides.titel: North Sea Summit: Actions Must Follow Words
slides.text: AquaVentus calls for consistent implementation of political commitments on integrated use of North Sea energy potential. Offshore wind and offshore hydrogen must be planned together.

slides.titel: Grid Development Plan Needs Urgent Changes
slides.text: The current NEP draft by transmission system operators fails to meet the requirements of a modern energy system. AquaVentus demands substantial additions in the offshore sector.

slides.titel: Wind Energy Amendment: Anchor Combined Connection Concepts Now
slides.text: AquaVentus demands clear legislative measures for combined electricity and pipeline connections of offshore wind farms — already standard practice in all other North Sea countries.

slides.titel: Reducing System Costs by up to €1.7 Billion per Year
slides.text: The Frontier Economics study proves: Sector-coupled integration of offshore electrolyzers with wind farms reduces not just H₂ costs, but overall renewable expansion costs.
Between warm candlelight and lively conversations, connections emerged that go far beyond the business sphere. Behind the projects are people who share a common vision with passion.
